channel.title: What does this code mean - just look, probably simple -
channel.description: [code]addSkillXP(360*getLevelForXP(playerXP[5]), 5);[/code] Thats just part of the code, but I am going to edit the xp and stuff, what does this code mean exactly? I know the asterisk symbol is used as multiplication in computers so, my guess is 360 *(times) player level, so if you were lvl 1 you would get 360 xp. Am I correct or am I wrong=\

item.title: What does this code mean - just look, probably simple -
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Unless there is another method affecting it, just change 360 to a lower number.

Read full topic

item.title: What does this code mean - just look, probably simple -
item.dc:creator: @99range_k0 99range k0
item.description:
@99range_k0 wrote:

frostscapeserver:

That looks more like a skill code. I think that gives you more xp than normal for making bars, or bows, etc. Check the item ID and repost.

I know its a skill id… I was simply posting originally just 1 part… And asking like for example what does the 360 mean… And if you read responces, I found out what they meant, but Idk how to change it so you receive slower xp… As its very fast now…

Read full topic

item.title: What does this code mean - just look, probably simple -
item.dc:creator: @99range_k0 99range k0
item.description:
@99range_k0 wrote:

how could I modify it to make it go twice as slow as this?I tried editing those numbers but it didn’t work.
heres full code : if(ItemID == 536){ deleteItem(536, 1); addSkillXP(360*getLevelForXP(playerXP[5]), 5); sM("You receive some prayer experience."); setAnimation(894); lowGFX(247,0); }

Read full topic
item.source: What does this code mean - just look, probably simple -

item.title: What does this code mean - just look, probably simple -
item.dc:creator: @ChaosPkers ChaosPkers
item.description:
@ChaosPkers wrote:

it adds 360 xp than it checks for the players level in that skill and adds more depending on it.

so it doesn’t take fucking forever from lvl 98 lets say to 99

Read full topic
